intro: Misanteca tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It possesses slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along its stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers, followed by tiny, fleshy berries that serve as a food source for birds and other animals. Its root system includes haustoria, which allow it to absorb water and nutrients from its host. Misanteca tenuifolia plays a role in ecosystem dynamics by influencing host tree health and providing sustenance for wildlife.
